0.name: Speed limit (20km/h)
0.description: Maximum speed allowed is 20 kilometers per hour. Usually found in residential or school areas.

1.name: Speed limit (30km/h)
1.description: Maximum speed allowed is 30 kilometers per hour.

2.name: Speed limit (50km/h)
2.description: Maximum speed allowed is 50 kilometers per hour. Standard limit in built-up areas.

3.name: Speed limit (60km/h)
3.description: Maximum speed allowed is 60 kilometers per hour.

4.name: Speed limit (70km/h)
4.description: Maximum speed allowed is 70 kilometers per hour.

5.name: Speed limit (80km/h)
5.description: Maximum speed allowed is 80 kilometers per hour.

6.name: End of speed limit (80km/h)
6.description: The restriction of maximum speed 80km/h ends here.

7.name: Speed limit (100km/h)
7.description: Maximum speed allowed is 100 kilometers per hour.

8.name: Speed limit (120km/h)
8.description: Maximum speed allowed is 120 kilometers per hour.

9.name: No passing
9.description: Overtaking other motor vehicles is prohibited for all types of vehicles.

10.name: No passing for vehicles over 3.5 metric tons
10.description: Overtaking is prohibited for heavy goods vehicles exceeding 3.5 tons.

11.name: Right-of-way at the next intersection
11.description: You have the priority at the upcoming intersection.

12.name: Priority road
12.description: You are on a main road with priority over intersecting traffic until cancelled by an 'End of Priority Road' sign.

13.name: Yield
13.description: Give way to traffic on the main road. You must slow down or stop if necessary.

14.name: Stop
14.description: You must come to a complete stop at the stop line and yield to all traffic.

15.name: No vehicles
15.description: All vehicles are prohibited from entering this road.

16.name: Vehicles over 3.5 metric tons prohibited
16.description: Entry is forbidden for heavy vehicles exceeding 3.5 tons.

17.name: No entry
17.description: One-way street. Entry is forbidden from this direction.

18.name: General caution
18.description: General danger ahead. Be alert and prepared for unspecified hazards.

19.name: Dangerous curve to the left
19.description: The road curves sharply to the left ahead.

20.name: Dangerous curve to the right
20.description: The road curves sharply to the right ahead.

21.name: Double curve
21.description: A series of dangerous curves ahead, the first one being to the left.

22.name: Bumpy road
22.description: The road surface ahead is uneven or contains large bumps.

23.name: Slippery road
23.description: The road may be especially slippery, particularly when wet or icy.

24.name: Road narrows on the right
24.description: The road becomes narrower on the right side ahead.

25.name: Road work
25.description: Road maintenance or construction is in progress. Watch for workers and machinery.

26.name: Traffic signals
26.description: Traffic lights ahead. Be prepared to stop.

27.name: Pedestrians
27.description: Pedestrian crossing or high pedestrian activity ahead.

28.name: Children crossing
28.description: Often located near schools or playgrounds. Be extremely cautious of children.

29.name: Bicycles crossing
29.description: Watch for cyclists entering or crossing the road.

30.name: Beware of ice/snow
30.description: Road conditions may be hazardous due to ice or snow accumulation.

31.name: Wild animals crossing
31.description: Area where deer or other wild animals frequently cross the road.

32.name: End of all speed and passing limits
32.description: All previously indicated speed limits and overtaking restrictions end here.

33.name: Turn right ahead
33.description: Mandatory direction of travel is to the right.

34.name: Turn left ahead
34.description: Mandatory direction of travel is to the left.

35.name: Ahead only
35.description: Mandatory direction of travel is straight ahead. No turns allowed.

36.name: Go straight or right
36.description: Mandatory direction: you must either go straight or turn right.

37.name: Go straight or left
37.description: Mandatory direction: you must either go straight or turn left.

38.name: Keep right
38.description: Drive on the right side of the obstacle or island.

39.name: Keep left
39.description: Drive on the left side of the obstacle or island.

40.name: Roundabout
40.description: Mandatory direction of travel in a circular motion (roundabout).

41.name: End of no passing
41.description: The prohibition of overtaking other vehicles ends here.

42.name: End of no passing by vehicles over 3.5 metric tons
42.description: The overtaking restriction for heavy vehicles ends here.
